twVFkwEQQqRj4_YtlkNCWA.text: Great Mexican food!! Good price and really quick service been going for years they are always consistent

xDtv1T3oZEW8dRdY76z6UQ.text: This is about as bad as Mexican food gets. Honestly, I can't really think of how my meal could have been any worse aside from them just taking a dump on my plate.

0WVuRam0345bw3w2tD5OXw.text: This place reminds me of Filibertos. I had their country burrito and it was super yummy. Had potatoes, eggs, and cheese in it. Price wise wasn't bad. Will come again.

imFaJO3PXVdpIQZWBCsR6w.text: I absolutely LOVE the tortilla' they use here. They are so fresh and well made I just want to create an entire bed sheet out of them and sleep with a freshly pressed and warm tortilla every night. This place fuels our internet department mornings at least once a week... Affordable, fast, clean and high quality.

_98GoqWdGVnynRelwNl3zQ.text: Great spot for a burrito. They are amazing and they are HUUUUUGE. Great save in fridge for few days.

jf91RxUiBh0DvP6RxBOVLg.text: Got the Chorizo Breakfast Burrito. It was ok, Just a little too greasy for my likings. And when I say greasy, I mean it looked like I killed someone afterwards. I know that the Chorizo is greasy, but I have never eaten one this greasy, ever! If I'm ever strolling by, I might give this another shot and try something else.   Regardless, I still enjoyed the service.

BWhaMgD4UEYtLlEH-K5FbQ.text: Place has been a local spot for some time. Food is pretty good. However prices have really gone up..seems like they make up thier own prices at times. Last few orders have been wrong & window services not the friendliest. Yes we will continue to go but with less frequency mostly due to the high cost of the meals.

wkTy8dLKXquowMh7G2qKEA.text: I literally have to utilize all self control each time I drive by Fiesta. Definitely one of my favorite spots to drive through and get lunch during a busy day. I get a #2 and a bean and cheese burrito and obviously extra sides of the red sauce. SO GOOD!

CkxZWtwl2OkOfbyaUIJbvw.text: UPDATE: after my last experience with Fiesta Burrito I have to say I AM NEVER GOING BACK. Why? I asked for a California burrito with guacamole, got charged for the guacamole, but it was never in my burrito. The burrito seemed to shrink 10% more than the last time I thought it shrank. It was definitely not worth the price at all. I  also got charged for an extra drink. When I went back to ask for my refund for the guacamole and the extra drink I was charged for the men just looked at me like I was crazy. He offered me a cup instead (which I didn't need I already had my drink) and I saw one man in the back filling up a tiny cup of guacamole (which I didn't need either because I had already eaten the tiny burrito) All I wanted was my $3.00 back for things I never received.   this place is always my go-to place for fast late night Mexican Food (only when Tacos Jalisco is closed) cleaner also. I know I wont have to worry about cockroaches roaming my food. I love how theyre so fast, and the food comes out tasting decent.  what I am concerned about is how small their burritos have gotten over the years. don't get me wrong, theyre still beasts, but they have definitely shrank in width. i know regulars would agree. their customer service is a bit lacking, so don't feel bad if theyre not attentive and don't exactly cater to your needs. you have to tell them if you want any extras and other customizations.   regardless, this is the place to go for super fast delicious Mexican food, that wont make you sick! PARTY burrito!

QqpfSeHux7YM6YubK14fBQ.text: nasty, I will not be coming here again. I have tried both their California burrito and their chorizo burrito and both are so greasy it's unreal. I understand that a chorizo burrito is going to be a little greasy but that was literally all I could taste, not good, stay far from this place!

N9KGNRZwrgK6_UGJKKPH3Q.text: Never in my many visits to Fiesta Burrito...and there have been a lot of them...have I been disappointed.    Never has the food tasted like it was made a week ago.  Never have I had to spit anything out, hoping it had, at least, originated from the cow.  Never have I had cause, or been afraid to check the restaurant inspections naughty list.  I am a fan.

nnf2Bo21VTVGaBl_EuVxPQ.text: You want it quick...booom! Taste...well..it  was fast...ka pow!!! YeH!!!good enough for me...be starving....nope.. no where close to new mex chillie. But ya gotta live were you be

j6SRwdN3ES1hhTqISbKL3A.text: Really good! Tasty, clean, professional, friendly... solid sauces... great fixings bar. It's perhaps a little surprising to find them somewhat out of the way but they are way above average for fast food, and a very good value. This place always makes me happy. Thumbs way up.

5pMeFddCCgURAM4uWY-k5A.text: In the office, Fiesta Burrito is aptly known as "across the street."  Kind of like, "How about across the street?"  "Yeah, I could do across the street, today."  If I ever said, "How about Fiesta Burrito?"  I would get, "Where's that?"  Then I would have to say, "You know, across the street."  And the response would be, "Well, why didn't you say so in the first place."  The primary reason we eat at "across the street" is because it is convenient - it's across the street.  And in the immortal words of my most quotable co-worker, "It is fast, cheap, and good -- no questions asked."  The part about it being good is debatable.  I could do with a little less greasy.  Fast, no question.  And despite that fact that "across the street" charges 60 cents for spicy carrots now, the prices are low.  I like the chorizo plate with a side of sour cream, although I might start branching out as we eat at "across the street" way too much, and I'm getting tired of always having the same thing.  At just above a dive, I would call it a hole in the wall, but really, it is just a generic Mexican joint that hides in plain sight.  Even the name is rather plain as no one can seem to remember it.  There is a smallish, generic inside dining area, which is accompanied by a small, generic patio for outside dining.  Some high school students seem to come by for lunch leave.  The staff is polite.  Until they move or I no longer work across the street, I'll be a regular.

pJqEd32pYOfcUyvtlSK1Jw.text: Bean burritos!  Cheap and good! I eat for two days. The food is great, and the staff is really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SXoGlWTAR6bi0mO_SLi0Tw.text: Quick service and reasonable prices. The food was pretty good, not too greasy like some had mentioned. The only down was the food wasn't hot enough, my cheese enchiladas were not melted at all and were even cold in the middle.

kQ_yqOvIQ3gxj46lW17Zqw.text: This is my favorite quick bite to eat in the area.  I stop in so much for the carne asada burritos that the guys there know me and always say hi.    I'd say the only downside is they recently raised prices so it's not quite so easy on the wallet to get a meal anymore, but I live my life one burrito at a time and it works.

7gDNKc6_rzarorNTaLUHSQ.text: It pains me to read anything even slightly negative about this place. It is about as close to authentic Mexican food as you can get without the risk of stray bullet shots from the Cartel. That is why I go there - not for the ambiance or the decor - but for the raw Mexican deliciousness that is the burrito. One guy speaks competent English, everyone else is laser focused on wrapping up your choice burrito in under 3 minutes. It is a Fiesta Flavor Factory.  For the size and taste of these burritos I would easily spend $10 a pop. I usually pay about $8 because I throw in a few dollars tip. Why do I throw in a big tip? Well, these authentic chefs probably don't get paid much, but they sure do make my day when I walk in and leave within 3 minutes with a burrito the size of Mark McGwires forearm in my grasp - they earned that extra few dollars. God bless each one of them.  Some people complain about the quality of the meat - sorry, Bobby Flay! It's a fast food burrito stop. It is like walking into a bowling alley and talking smack about their furniture. C'mon Brendan Dassey, use your logic. If you want super high quality meat's go up to AJ's fine foods and pay $16 for a nice 4 oz organic chicken breast. If you want a monster burrito you're going to dream about until the next one, then man up and stop being a little girl. To the guy who whined about there not being enough salt: ummm, it's a burrito, if there is not enough salt for you maybe you should re-evaluate your diet and stop beer bonging soy sauce.  Lastly, as I conclude my rant in defense of the magnificence that is Fiesta Burrito, I go here to feel the best I can about a bad diet decision. It's my favorite cheat meal. It is a brilliant place to eat quickly at an affordable price, so don't listen to the haters, just go get your burrito on, would ya?

JR8X3j1huoLQM8NT66wmOg.text: If you like chimichanga's you need to give this place a try. Although McDowell & Scottsdale Rd is kinda no man's land you should still give it a try.

Rb1lyrJrBKp-sBt_yljigQ.text: Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm. Go here for a breakfast burrito. Or the carne asada. Or anything really. It's fast, it's cheap, it's delicious, and there's a drive thru.  If there's such thing as good hangover memories, I've had a lot of them here.

p9BTqE-M4_wyAhDz4bJm9w.text: The food is good and the prices are good.  The food always seems to be a lot less greasy then those *beto places. Love it!  Carnitas burrito for me every time.

HEPXQ4bwa1ydzjbXnbtLxw.text: This is my go to taqueria in Scottsdale, inexpensive and really good food.    They have the best veggie burrito I have had in AZ, although can be inconsistent.  Sometimes you have to tell them what you want in it.  The 1st time I went there, they simply made me a veggie burrito with beans, rice, lettuce, etc and it was awesome.  On several other occasions, they ask me what I want in it.  On another occasion, the rice was left out altogether, so was not as good in my opinion.  This is a little odd, but no big deal.  Just be sure to tell them what you want in it.  Tacos and burritos are typical offerings, and all tasty.  I have had many items and was always pleased and satisfied.    The service and portions are a somewhat inconsistent.  It is difficult to predict what experience you might have on any given day.  Some counter servers are nice.  Some are not so nice.  None are outright rude or anything like that.   They have a drive thru that is pretty quick - I have used it at least 10 times.  The place gets very busy and parking lot is tiny.  I have seen the drive thru line to where you are in the street waiting to get into the parking lot.  And it is often tough to get a spot in the lot.  But you can always park a couple doors down at Bosa Donut and walk up to Fiesta, and then get an apple fritter for dessert ... bonus!

wmN7N0wUfkOLfF6r7kfcXA.text: Best Quick Mexican Food, in Tempe/Scottsdale so far, love there rolled tacos and just recently tried there Carne California burrito for 4.15 it's cheap too!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California - Carne burrito plus beans and rice.

nNjhUjEkUAboQLRERO2itA.text: It was "ok" nuthin special but maybe i came at a wrong time...very quick service && alot for your monies!

Qs-0LgFtunHe8e6haQDCvw.text: Good solid burrito joint food.  It seems much cleaner and better run than most -berto places. You won't be overwhelmed with the hugeness of your burrito but it's (somewhat) made up for in quality.  Good value, nice owner. delicious food.

915LDJSdSqEiafIHMRr89g.text: If you don't know about this place, you are missing out. For one, the prices are very cheap. Second, the food is amazing. Best bean and cheese burrito I've ever had. Breakfast burritos are amazing as well.    Another great thing about this place is the menu. There is a very large selection.  While this place may look like Filibertos, a Phoenix staple, its food is far superior.

y39OHW5sJHQVWYLO6B6cxw.text: One of the best burritos I have ever had. The staff was friendly and quick service.  I found this using Yelp and it did not disappoint.

lcgKmxT0Ocx03Xx5D6c55A.text: Fiesta is my place! Ever since I bought my house down the street nearly 4 years ago Fiesta has been a staple in my life. Breakfast burritos on weekends, Cheese only Quesadilla for my 2 little nuggets... AZ burro's and Grande Quesadilla for dinners.   I also love their enchilada meals with a side of Mexi Rice and beans. Everything here is delicious, and breakfast burritos at night...oh mann!!!  Also, if you want something quick or for an appetizer, chips quac and cheese for the win! Can't say enough about it.. Love love love!

C_ik8r6iF6BWLHwMEN1jew.text: Their carne asada fries are my go to order, they're so good you can't go wrong with them and they give you a lot of red and green hot sauces which I love. The drive thru and late hours are convenient and make it the perfect spot for your late night cravings. You have to get the horchata, it's amazing!

_plCSM_AAwHh-5_iYHkhrQ.text: Amazing place! Cheap, fast and delicious! My favorite is their machaca breakfast burrito! They serve it all day! Pro Tip: get guacamole in it for a few bucks more it is so worth it! Also their horchata is awesome! I love you Fiesta Burrito! Keep doing your thing. Oh and ask for the red salsa!

VsnFpx5YLSMZ_T5HGsaLhA.text: I'm so glad I live across the street from this place. Their food is fresh and tastes "clean". The carne asada burrito is a go-to if you're starving. If not, I get a carne asada taco which is super cheap. Love fiesta, they're open all the time, great for any meal of the day really.

OJoVdBLN_5_HyUdHbkHArA.text: I'm pretty picky with mexican food but they do a great job here and have a 24 hour drive through which is awesome! The staff is friendly and the food is really good too!

-xonsvg-PiAkqhdw4g2lHA.text: DUDE! This place is so bomb. I just moved here from LA, and I probably come here twice a week. Carne Asada Burrito and Fries are soooo good. They're quick and the taste is incredible!! Definitely go here and get yourself a good meal!

TjhImUGFRr1FBDsn3jj0lQ.text: I love this place.  The food is always good. I live across the street and eat here at least twice a week.  I tell all my friends to come here and so far they are in love with this place as much as I am.  The female cashier is always a bitch but the food is so good it's worth getting dirty looks from here and dealing with her shity Attitude  Update.  Fiesta burrito has wrote me back with very kind works.  And best believe I'll still be coming back 2-3 times a week still.  The food is too delicious to and having a rude employee won't stop me from returning.   Keep up the good work.   Best Mexican food ever.   I love this place.

8kb5hnNRhnuboka2NDdfZA.text: Not a bad spot for late night/after hours food.  The carne asada burrito and soft tacos are good, and they hit the spot. The green chile burrito is pretty bland tho .  The red sauce/salsa definitely has a little kick to it and helps if u like spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green chile burrito
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carne asada burrito
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

s89f7clI3bleU5zQW-Oe5w.text: I've lived down the road from this place since they opened having never stopped in. I have my excellent go-to Mexican restaurants, so trying new ones isn't something I have to do often. Today, however, that changed when I realized It was 12 am and I had still not eaten dinner.   After a quick Yelp to determine which restaurants were still open, I settled on Fiesta Burrito bc of the strong reviews. A breakfast burrito is what I craved, and this place delivered. Double bacon, potato, egg, and cheese. It was fast. The bacon was real bacon, unlike some of the burrito joints that fake the bacon w burnt spiral cut ham. The cashier was friendly and made sure i left with enough hot sauce, an absolute necessity in my world. Also, 7$ for a double meat burro was a price I appreciate.   I'm adding this place to my regular rotation.

OPt2UUaXRcQOA4iGEz5Ffg.text: High expectations based on the reviews, as I love divey burrito spots.   Unfortunately, expectations were not met.  I had the breakfast burrito with machaca.  Three basic issues.  First, the burrito was bland.  Not much flavor at all.  Second, the salsas are disappointing - super watery and very little flavor.  You can't have a great burrito without great salsa.  One point deduction for the salsa fail.  Finally, there was too much tortilla, not enough filling.  I get they want to keep the price low, and that's fine, but don't use such a big tortilla if you're not going to fill it.  Another point deducted for the underfilled tortilla.  Overall, not worth the longish drive out from Paradise Valley.

ehcg04t1leFPWQ-hBSd-nA.text: Really delicious and cheap Mexican food. I have been coming here for a year now. The food is filling, greasy, and well priced.

HBZ174iVYnqfJBTyCtpcLg.text: Excellent food.  Portions are big, so bring your appetite!  Prices are reasonable too, especially when you see the portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Food was awesome and in a generous portion.

vVSNZ1S_bR9p-l-2SSARfQ.text: The food here is awesome, I wish I could give this place 5 stars I really do. I took a star away for how stingey they are with their salsa, they're literally the worst about it out of all the Mexican places I've been to.  I feel like I have to barter for salsa at the window. Or you ask for 8 greens they say OK and there's only 3 when you get home. It says clearly on their window that they charge for extra salsa, which is tacky but fine, I'll pay extra to enjoy my food the way I want it and I always make sure I ask BEFORE I give them payment so that they still have the option to charge me. Still I trust them (even tip them to show appreciation for getting hooked up on the salsa front) and get home to a disappointing amount of salsa to go with my food. I took another star away for being charged extra for something I didn't order once and not noticing until I pulled an extra burrito out of my to go bag, and for being charged for sides of sour cream that I never got twice. Great food, but check your order and your receipt before driving happily home to enjoy.

oY9_VG0g4vbnpchP1-FcMw.text: Always great food and quick service! Definitely a go to and one of the best places to get a burrito.

PZ4CrjbF0AKFiMBU22v4fA.text: The closest authentic taco joint open late in Scottsdale... lol three rolled tacos and a machaca torta and horchata at 12am. Food was fast. I was a fan of the three rolled tacos, the guac was great, but everything else was just good... I kinda wanted amazing... will try again someday.

6fPvK4Ov54c4VLn0sodF7Q.text: Quick, good, reasonably priced.   Not too spicy, but they do have hot sauce available to add.   Most plates average about $8.50 and most single entrees are $4-6.

uulmD-MmCQqI8dS3Dk2tbQ.text: Fiesta Burrito is a great Mexican Food restaurant.  If you're not very hungry, one taco will fill you up, probably almost 4 oz of meat.  The two-burrito combinations are an awesome deal.  I like that their chicken is slow cooked and falls apart; it is not greasy. They fill their tacos and burritos with a good portion of chicken.  Their carne asada is good quality and lean.  In the carne asada plate, they serve a few big slices, and in the tacos it's chopped; you won't get a lot of chopped pieces of fat; maybe one or two, it's quite lean.  If you're hungry for a taco, but also want a bit of beans, order a tostada.  The burrito mixta has machaca beef, beans, and green chiles. It's excellent.

l82KWp8xTJTzmq0qMSSFYA.text: Compared to other similar restaurants, the food here is not over priced , its never greasy and the service is great.

hm2snGK4hBM1DQ0vC8RXWQ.text: Really appreciated finding this spot, with the help of Yelp, while stranded in the area. Yes, it's a basic burrito/taco joint, but the quality of its food is definitely above many of its competitors.   My first selection was a chicken taco. Didn't really expect much. I was delighted to receive a taco stuffed with shredded white chicken, not the "are you sure this is chicken?" mixture you sometimes receive elsewhere. The chicken wasn't really that well seasoned, but you can spice to taste with a salsa bar that is stocked with red sauce, green sauce and veggies. The menu has a lot of variety, much more than the establishment's name would imply. Burritos, tacos, tortas, enchiladas, tostadas, chimichangas, quesadillas... and great combination plates priced mostly around seven dollars.   The dining room is minimal, in both size and decor, just as it should be. There is a shaded outdoor patio with additional seating.  The staff is friendly and food is quickly prepared. There is also a drive thru. Located near SkySong, Fiesta Burrito is wedged in among some other restaurants, fast food and otherwise. Open for breakfast and late night.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Exterior on a rainy day
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shaded Patio
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior

DtjG0Fyeh8YcTht6rkE5PQ.text: Best Carne Asada Burrito I've had since moving from CA. Good sized burrito too, and I didn't even break $6 before tip. A lil bit out of the way of my house in Mesa but I'll happily make the drive anytime.

_hEqazQAnZhKbudgTcmp3g.text: Best fast, cheap, roll thru at midnight w the munchies kinda place. So as of right now, I'd say this is the tastiest food I've had in my life. Also compelled me to make my v first yelp review so call it how you see it

coayzs9mDA8jh1F-8fHf7A.text: This place is south Scottsdale's dirty little secret.  If you want the awesome authentic taste of a real hole-in-the-wall mexican restaurant but with the speed of a XXX-ertos (minus the Hepatitis), this is the place to go.  I've been to this place at least twenty times and I think I only ever order four things there because they're so good: the super nachos, the rolled tacos with guacamole, chicken tacos and the two carne asada burrito plate.  Any of these selections are guaranteed to keep you full for at least ten hours.  Everything comes out piping hot and both the green and red salsa provided are excellent additions to the already tasty flavors provided.  If you are in the mood for Mexican food and you're within a ten mile radius of this place, it's certainly worth the drive.

6bS8G2FkQcXnsNcADPKjEA.text: I've been trying various cheap mexican food "stands" in an effort to find something that resembles what you find in San Diego.  Fiesta Burrito is the best I've found in the valley.  (note: Los Favoritos is up there with it)  I've had mostly burritos and rolled tacos, but I've really liked them.  Carne Asada, bean-and-cheese, and breakfast burritos have all been very solid.  I like the rolled tacos, as well.  My companion on a recent visit ordered the "rolled tacos supreme" (where they pile carne asada and other stuff on top of 5 rolled tacos).  Wow, I'd never noticed that before...can I try one?  In a word, awesome.  Not very practical to eat, but really yummy.  Although I expect (and accept) a little tummy-turning after a meal at a place like this, I've never had even the slightest grumble after eating at Fiesta.  It's cheap and they DO accept credit cards.

NTYV5Lt7h8llWNavJyUy3A.text: good food. their tortas and chimichangas are delicious :D anyone know what oil they use on their meats/breads? thanks.

Ad9JEK6VDjhbWm0gXKioKA.text: I guess I'm just spoiled to the authentic Mexican food we have back home in Southern California. But after a long long day of drinking on the Salt River, The group decided to swing by Fiesta Burrito in an effort to feed our beer munchies  Again like all Authentic Mexican places they take cash only, that being said, I had to spot a buddy of mine for his meal. I ordered the rolled taco's w/ guac and a carne asada burrito. I was blown away.....no carne asada fries?? That's a staple back home!!!  The burrito was pretty big and had tons of carne asada packed in there, the rolled taco's had a good amount of guac on em but skimpy on the cheese. Also this did cost a little more than what I'm used to paying back at home. I guess if I need a Mexican fix and I'm out in AZ I'll come back but other than that I'll be glad to go home to Alerto's, Los Alazanes, and Taqueria de Anda for some Carne Asada Fries.

zxDUL3cYHayutjj1rAajuQ.text: Simply put... I go here every single week. I think it is the best 24hr burrito shop. I don't know why, i just like the ingrediants and the way they cook their food.  Pork Adobas (sic) burrito with guac is amazing california burritos are my favorite love the chile relleno burrito as well..  Place is AWESOME.  ALot of these places can be all the same, but Fiesta I think is the best.

HfLBvkujtsQGEsNiCGqthw.text: 3 rolled taco with cheese...   Fast friendly service   Great tasting food.

04HwRhRzN5k83FfxbwAjqA.text: Somewhat of a regular.  I always get the bean and cheese chimichanga.  Never had an issue.  Food always comes out fast and piping hot.  Probably the best chimi for the price, anywhere.  I'll always come back to you, Fiesta Burrito.  Viva la salsa roja!

DKLdFr4zLjSzrzD7-aaC5Q.text: Breakfast burrito's are pretty much my favorite food in the whole world. Fiesta's Country Burrito definitely contributes to this. Fresh tortilla, eggs, potatoes, cheese - add refried beans and their amazing green salsa... it's a beautiful thing, really.   Plus they have the best Dr Pepper ever, the perfect mix of carbonation and syrup.   It's also friendly, cheap, fast and a three minute drive from my house. LOVE

pq-g2lQA9ctzKXBBQL-XCw.text: Always getting the two tacos and the super nachos here... its my late night addiction haha

UgtJiFiLqYyNamydnzsD-w.text: It's got a good chorizo breakfast burrito. If you dine in, it would be nice to have a more convenient salsa selection. If you're taking it to go, you might have your own salsa/hot sauce solution, so that's not a big deal. I like their drive through and customer friendliness.

23SdiS01vE2ftDRBb54-0w.text: 5 stars had they put more rice, but rice portion is generous I'm just a rice eater I want more! Two consecutive meals that I ordered #13 Fish Taco with beans and rice for $7. I love the green sauce that comes with it. I also like how they overflow it with lettuce. I just love it I want it for lunch tomorrow ( I just had it for dinner today)

YCnpFE9SgSCgkjPnXW166A.text: A rare yelp disappointment!  Just a touch about Filiberto's and that's a very generous compliment.    I ordered the two carne asada burrito combo with rice and beans.  The rice was bland and room temperature as was the beans.  My wife chewed on something that definitely wasn't carne asada and had to spit it out.  My carne asada was rubbery and just average at best. Everything about this place was a disappointment, even the prices which I thought were actually high for a hole-in-the-wall that you have to look hard to find.    Do yourself a favor and get a carne asada somewhere else.

rOnTWk5FDN8tlnGAqTPdUQ.text: OK, first of all this is not a 5 star restaurant. It is however an awesome drive thru and quick sit down spot. Their food is great. Try the California Burrito! Ayaya. Love it!

BXICnYyiVH4cBddPAjJfsw.text: :::::PROS:::::  Clean, clean, clean.  The cooking environment, the floor, the condiment area, the tables - all spotless.  Cheap, cheap, cheap.  Most burritos are in the 3-dollar range, and you can't beat the quality for the price.  The chicken burrito incorporated medium spicy shredded chicken done just right, and the breakfast burrito used eggs, ham, cheese, onions, and green peppers to get it done.  Breakfast served all-day!  I know other Mexican restaurants do the same, but given the fact Fiesta Burrito is tantalizingly tasty, it just sweetens the deal.  Great Pico De Gallo, and Red Sauce at the condiment bar!  Need I say more?  :::::CONS:::::  None.  Fiesta Burrito is nice and bright on the inside, and so seemed it's staff.  I believe the crew were truly enjoying themselves the day I went in and the smile on the man's face while washing the floor was refreshingly genuine and sincere.  Its obvious that its a well-run establishment, but its also one of those places that makes me wonder because the food IS so cheap...  Seriously.  How can places like J in the Box and McD's sell Chicken Sammies for a buck?  And the three dollar burrito?  I just can't see the profit margin...  But then again, I've never run a restaurant.  I mean - Fiesta's ingredients can't be that cheap, right???  Regardless, Fiesta Burrito is great bargain, and the food that I've tried so far knocked my socks clean off.  Check it out.

9NbjHp-aze8o8W_JOgW6Yg.text: This is my favorite of similar type places by far. We used to Los Betos at the end of nights on the town & in a pinch when we didn't want to cook (as there is one quite near). At some point, the quality had dropped far enough that we hit Fiesta Burrito. My sister had been lauding this place for years.  Well, it is not only my favorite drive-thru/semi-fast Mexican food spot, it's one of my favorite value places in town. Cheap great food super quick. It's already kind of a stand by for me & the kids when the Mrs. does a girls night out. Also open quite late which is a major bonus (as both of my other cheap Mexican favorites have limited hours - Carolina's & Rito's).  Their food is excellent. Super tasty, reasonable, quick. Nice clean atmosphere, super friendly staff.  I typically go with the taco combination as they do the deep fried shredded beef tacos that are so yummy. Their carne asada is also brilliant. Great beans. They have a nice salsa bar as well. The Mrs. likes the green & red chile quite well too.  Can't miss with Fiesta Burrito.

J9Y04uIyOv-rX3zabe_57g.text: Having left my packed lunch safely in the fridge at home (an event that happens far more often than I'd like to admit) I set off to try something new for lunch today. Fiesta Burrito was a great choice; thank you yelp!  I ordered the machaca plate, no. 11. A generous helping of machaca with egg, onions, peppers, cheese, and rice and beans on the side. A flour tortilla to scoop it all up with, some fresh pico de gallo and salsa verde from the salsa bar and I was set for a great lunch.  The food was great and inexpensive. The service was friendly and the location was very clean.   They have a big menu with several combination plates, all with rice and beans, breakfast food served all day, and some great a la carte options if you don't want the full meal.  Compared to other drive-through/quick order Mexican food places around, my meal here was comparable to Carolina's. That's the highest praise I can think to give a place like this.  I'll definitely be back.

b8WIdOsns9EJq8mMvlfdpg.text: meh.   I had to shlep over to the new post office just north of McDowell and had read good reviews about this place so I thought I would give a try.  Used the drive-thru so I can't comment on the cleanliness. Nice tip jar hanging on the drive thru window *eyeroll*. I honestly don't have a problem with tipping. However, do we tip at taco bell? No. Or do we? Yet? Urg.  The bean and cheese burrito was runny and salty. Their hot sauce was watery and not even close to hot - probably because it was mostly water. I also got their beef taco. My eyes are always bigger than my stomach. One bite and it was actually decent, but I was done, full. I wish I would have eaten the taco first and skipped the bean burrito. We all know you can't save a taco. It becomes a mushy mess - no ones fault but the nature of the taco.  Los Favoritos has them beat by FAR. If you're a fan of Fiesta Burrito, make the drive to LF and give it a try.  Btw, that new Post Office - clusterfuck.

TRyFglktetIWZ6kLfNvqZQ.text: I'm giving it 4 stars purely for the Carne Asada burrito. it's so good!!! I've tried other items on the menu and was not impressed. The shredded chicken was greasy and just stuffed with too much cheese, and I couldn't even finish it. They also have a horrible drive thru. You have no idea what they are saying. I orderedsome rolled tacos with no cheese only guac, and they gave me rolled tacos with cheese and no gauc. I was so angry. I love guac! So check your food before leaving if going thru the drive thru.

qmP7mGEaqL-a3lyHy-6ToA.text: Number 18 baby! 2 carne asada burritos with rice and beans! Me and the Mr will share that plus a cheese quesadilla.. super friendly drive thru service on the cheap! Many notches above your standard 'Berto's fare.. here the ingredients seem of better quality plus my ass doesn't hurt the next day! Can't go wrong here!

hMV8Y5eFtKv_EF6l3JFNwA.text: Probably one of my fave 'hole in the wall' mexican food places around. There's not too many of these types of places in North Scottsdale, so it's a nice place to stop for lunch when I'm working in Old Town; convenient location.  They have the best adobada burritos around and their tacquitos are always fresh (as is all their food). I really can't begin to name off my faves because everything I've had there is great. Seating is limited, but don't let that deter you, they do have a drive thru and all their ingredients are fresh and doesn't take long to get your order.

TEPbs3SrGIgf3UM71kVhzA.text: This place is so tasty and way better than the other little "- - - - bertos" Mexican restaurants, the prices are awesome and the service is always super friendly. If you're in the area swing by and snag yourself a California burrito.

M3YaY1saN_NvshYxHLznrg.text: We came here after a night of very heavy drinking, or I should say during. We took to the drive through and got some food to help us out. I ordered some sort of pork burrito and it was shear bliss. I love Mexican food and didn't think anywhere could top Southern CA for its Mexican. I was wrong. This place was even drive through and it was amazing. The flavors were plentiful and delicious. I wanted to go back so bad the next day but sadly it never happened. I know where I'll be going though for my drunk food fixes next time I visit!

mNcp0j_60m7gDC2zNFL8iw.text: Love this place!! This place is fast and easy to get food from. They are open late and early. Their pricing is super affordable and the food is delicious!!

2B5mAgqyREr9PHNX629A9A.text: Huge tasty ham egg pico & cheese breakfast burrito for $4. Fast and pleasant service.  Sold.

TvOXRsNr5QDpV9CtEGDosQ.text: Mmmm! Thank you Fiesta, lunch with you is always good.  I'd recommend the mixed burrito with shredded beef, beans, and cheese with no veggies.

TNruOciQvOpz5gd-kHg00g.text: Have been going to for years. The food is consistently great. The prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend!

DYqnNdl_Ci8nbvGbvds_-Q.text: I used to go to this place when the food was good, so it's disappointing to have to write a bad review about it. The customer service has always been bad, but I was able to overlook that when I enjoyed the food. Now, however, the food quality has gone down drastically. They used to have the best green salsa that I would always get to go with the burritos. They must have changed that recipe...one part salsa with 3 parts water? Its awful!! Their rolled tacos are pretty much taquitos that you buy at the grocery store in the frozen foods.   The customer service is nonexistent! I always go through the drive-thru and every time I order and all they say is "Thank You"...no "pull around", no total, no repeating of the order for any mistakes. It's extremely awkward!! Then when you actually encounter humans the awkwardness increases tenfold when there is still no talking except to ask if you want the watery salsa, and to tell you the price (which changes EVERY TIME you go there, even if its twice in two days!). Fiesta I used to brag about you to all my friends, now I think the only person I would tell is my worst enemy so I could laugh about the awkwardness they will go through interacting with your restaurant.

B47qlZlfZfZSa-S0jzO43g.text: I'm a pretty big snob when it comes to Mexican food since I was raised on the good stuff.   The other day I had to have a burrito. I don't know why but NOTHING else would satisfy me. It had to be a bean burrito.   I made myself fresh tortillas for this purpose alone but I realized we didn't have any beans!! Frantically I called my grandma to ask if she had some and she said she just ran out. I didn't have all day to make fresh beans. I wanted a burrito now!  So finally I sucked it up and drove down the road to fiesta burrito. I thought to myself that as long as it was better than Taco Bell, I'd be able to satisfy my craving.  FOUR BUCKS FOR A DRIVE THROUGH BEAN BURRITO!?  I thought to myself that this was kind of expensive but I got it anyways. After all, I needed a burrito. What I got was worth it's weight in mexican gold.  What I was given was the biggest burrito that I'd ever seen in my life. Seriously this burrito could have ended me if it chose to. It was the best bean burrito that I'd ever had. Maybe even more than my grandmas homemade ones. I can't even begin to describe the joy I felt while eating this thing. I couldn't even eat half of it in one sitting. It actually became THREE separate meals for me. Each time I reheated it, it was still just as good as the first.   I know my mexican food, and this is probably the most authentic in the valley.

WExxYR0CUW438MfbsILKuA.text: I was recommended to check this place out last week. I have now been here twice since then. I've had the Chimichanga and the California burrito. The orders came out quickly and I received great service during both visits. The food here is great, rice and beans were rice and beans. But the Chimichanga has a nice crispiness and the tortilla seemed fresh and the chicken was delicious. The California burrito was also a great burrito. I wasn't expecting meat of that quality in a burrito under $5, but it was a welcome surprise.

7EGLX5y01y1qkDNrMGZ7qQ.text: I had a chorizo and egg burrito, my friend had a carne asada burrito, and I had a medium drink, and it was all less than $10.  That alone makes me like this place.  The fact that the burrito was pretty good sized, and extremely tasty, makes me love this place!  It's not in my neck of the woods, but I may be training in the area for another week. If so, I intend to stop in and try the nachos.

giSUoajpEViR3_CybVxL3w.text: OMG, seriously the best Carne Asada burrito I have ever ordered at a neighborhood Mexican food, drive thru style restaurant.  The meat is tender and not fatty, and the burrito is not greasy and heavy.  The portions are more than enough.  The breakfast burritos are also awesome.  In all honesty a $4.00 breakfast burrito will feed my husband and I.  So, if you are not big eater you can definitely share.

d9ly4PshK2n8V69Em4GipA.text: Great tacos shredded beef can't beat them best in town! Carrots and peppers with them perfect combo. Drive though speaker is horrible needs replacement. Easier to order inside, service is good place is clean and food is quality I normally avoid the all of the burttos places.. This place is great!

Qz0Ztcqmoto53IzymJiUDg.text: Not impressed, the burritos were small, lukewarm, and sort of bland. I feel like I tasted more tortilla than meat.  I tried the chicken, carnitas, and carne asada burritos.

R17ltLMYHVHdIMZhDjM_fw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. I go out of my way to come here. I live in ahwatukee but it doesn't matter how late it is I drive here. 90% of the times I order the california burrito and eat it with the amazing salsa verde. OMG I absolutely adore this AUTHENTIC Mexican food. I find it very cheap also.  Try their Horchata!! To die for. yes it is a small place but the drive thru you dont even wait 5 minutes. This is a little shack  but hey! those are the best!!! Been coming here since 2009 and if I could give them 100 stars, I would!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

uRVklwHh329DSoO_jxO64Q.text: I love Fiesta Burrito! The staff is friendly and welcoming, a real nice family owned joint.  My favorite is the Country Burrito; eggs, potatoes & cheese to which I always add sour cream & jalepenos.  My son loves the #20 - chimicangas, the #3 - 2 cheese enchies &  the #4 - cheese enchie & tostada. The #4 is a favorite of all of us. My daughter is all about the California burrito, no pico add sour cream. This place knows our faces by now and I can't believe I haven't written a review yet! The lack of a fifth star is because once I found meat in my burrito...I don't eat meat. BUT, they are awesome and a no brainer when it's time to eat and no one can agree which place is best! Yummy red sauce!

t-svp-ZOBm5_Hs3MrshZHQ.text: If homestyle Mexican food is what you're craving, this is where to go. Just a hole in the wall place with consistently decent food at modest prices. I've eaten there since it opened for business, and they've never disappointed. I sometimes call from my driveway, and pick up my breakfast minutes later on the way to work. The owner has his act together, as do those he employs. My two favorites are the green chile burrito and the chile rellenos. Don't miss the pickled carrots, peppers, and onions. If only they had ample parking, I'd give it 5 stars.

tE2XdTJwhu_ml7CNN32G1g.text: Awesome. Perfect example of the fine art of making excellent food from clean, fresh ingredients. Burrito, enchiladas, chimichanga....all exceptionally good. 10/10 would eat my next meal there.

gD_6MhoPPw2ljfwRuPuJnw.text: This place is so authentic, I wouldn't drink the water...  I was introduced to this place via a friend of a friend, who enjoyed the late night delight of real Mexican food. Guess, they just call it food. "Pause for laughter" Anyways, I tried this place once...too authentic for me but it was good! Its one of those places I spoke about. The washed out pics (cause you don't need to see them: Main theme rice, beans, some kind of meat), original spanish names for the dish, and drive thru...yes the mexican food drive thru! I love it. This places gets 4 stars because it didn't pass the health inspection report, but I still eat there despite. That's good food.

KyzyxrqNemti9qkhOfafBw.text: Once again, the Yelpers helped us when in unfamiliar territory.    We stayed a couple of nights at the 3 Palms and ended up having breakfast here and satisfying a late night munchies craving.    As stated in other reviews, this place is VERY clean. N Ot to say other places are not, but you don't feel like you are in a sleazy taco joint with questionable sanitary practices.  We both had a simple breakfast burrito for lunch.  While it was nothing to write home about, it was tasty and filling.  Our late night snack was a big time pleaser!  Had a few tacos and and an order of the rolled tacos with guacamole.  Perfect!  Would eat that same order for breakfast, lunch and dinner!  If you are in that neck of the woods, drop in and order up some good Mexican fast food!

os2V1DNWe0HlKe47auSYLg.text: Not even comparable to other Mexican fast food!  I haven't had one thing off their extensive menu I didn't like!  Chorizo or ANY breakfast burrito, tostada's, bean burritos... whatever.  Yummy,  and the service is consistently great.  Try their Carne Asada... Anything!  Lol. The local firemen are there several times a week so u know it has to be tasty!!

w-I8zPRqQKdTaDoUpriWow.text: The best food for the price that money can buy. I get a bean and cheese burrito with guacamole everytime. I love both their sauces, but green is the best.  Super fast and nice service.  If my health could afford it, I'd eat here everyday.

SD8dUHrr82kMporJRr_2cA.text: As a last minute change of plans when Maskadores was closed, this location was nearby. Prices seemed reasonable with generous helpings. Only complaint would be that their "fish" taco included what appeared to be a commercially sold fish stick as protein. The remainder of ingredients were fresh and delicious. Rolled Tacos Supreme were delicious and filling. Carne Asada was Delicious! Staff were helpful and gracious. Definitely will visit again.

mDGHrxfo9WE70QKhn1efjg.text: Fiesta Burrito is my favorite places to eat! I went today and ordered the carne asada nachos and a carne asada burrito. The nachos are piled with cheese, guacamole, sour cream, pico de gallo, beans and carne asada. The red salsa is beyond delicious so make sure to add it on your nachos or burrito. They also have pickled carrots that taste amazing with salt. If you are looking for great tasting Mexican food on the go or want to sit and enjoy a good meal I highly recommend Fiesta Burrito!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

J7ONRDKG7I1mwScXr3JmFw.text: The BOMBA!!! The carne was right, papas was right, the pico was flame! This is the spot to be!!! Q-vo!!!

Gt2lugaBQ33wzyE5ptMj6A.text: Listen, for a quick bite to eat for on the go, this place it great! I've come here a few times because I hate fast food and this place nailed it with being fast yet not fast foodish. I've ordered a bean and cheese burrito, chicken tacos, and quesadillas. The chicken was a tad bland and dry but beats taco bell by far. I'm glad I found it. Fresh and great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nachos that I stated getting into. No shortage of chicken with loads of beans, cheese and guacamole.

aZvuREQ_xygQ2eHDuwybzA.text: Fiesta Burrito is  big size portions, you get what you pay for. fresh Good Quality. My to go spot when I'm in the area. I like the carne asada burrito  and my husband likes the Beef chimichanga or fish  burrito! Oh can't forget the nachos and carne asada fries  on point boy

w8mMSRtOY0_532qpHknT0A.text: Not a bad little Mexican joint. Food is consistent but doesn't vary far from the classic Mexican fare, for good or bad. I h ent had this place before midnight so I couldn't tell you if the day crew is as solid as the night. Hah! I will return.

zL4X1Hz-2CU9xe8LtrsYQQ.text: Always great service and excellent food. Just wish they would open earlier....  Always been my favorite Ho to place for carne asada anything... Tacos, burritos, fries, nachos, or even the rolled taco supreme. Delish!!

7K7Wte0b0cLZzo8LcJpuiA.text: I have dinner here once a week and its a good spot. the super nachos and tostadas are really good. Make sure to double check your order if you ask for no meat!

kVKKd-L1PG8X0qP40owWjQ.text: Place is pretty hit or miss depending what time of the day it is.  My most recent visit I ordered 3 rolled tacos with cheese and Guacamole and a California Burrito.  The guy at the window asked if I wanted Red or Green Salsa...I replied I'd like SEVERAL of both.  I get home and I have one of each in the bag!  Little stuff like that is a deal breaker!  Stay away from the rolled tacos as they're absolutely flavorless and the guacamole is very subpar or at least it was tonight!  California Burrito with Carne Asada was good, it just would've been nice to have salsa.  Again very hit or miss!  I go here as it's in my area!  Note to self, check bag before driving off

WosEdZ80ee_2l2KXZs1KdA.text: Food is great. They always get my order correct. They do need to re-work the red hot sauce though. Way too hot. Wouldn't be an issue if they didn't overload the to-go bag with a bunch of red sauce and only a few green. The red sauce, although good, can only be used quite sparingly as it's pretty spicy. My only suggestion is to lessen up the spice in the red sauce so it's palatable. Put it this way; if the only thing I am complaining about is that I can't handle the red sauce, it means the place is pretty good. Definitely one of the best taco shops in the city.

AQ40nspvr9SY485rRqEWEw.text: Pretty great food! I ordered the beef chimichanga and definitely was not disappointed.  And, they are open late every day If you want a late night burrito. I just wish Iived in town so I could come back :)

WE6BQoRfwOc7ihWXlBRweA.text: I really don't think they know how to cook burritos I had the California Burrito their potatoes were under cooked overloaded it with pico de gallo it was far the worst burrito I ever had and pop it all the tortilla tasted doughy, but the customer service was good and that's about it so far I won't be coming back..

MmTN5z3lZIpyg52FxUJerw.text: Fiesta is great! Carne Asada Fries! Their food is so consistent and service is super fast! Give it a try they do not disappoint!!!

u7bCGZOuO2-vm1sJZL3Dgg.text: My go-to late night weekend joint for food after midnight or so when the pickins get slim. Quality of food remains good late night or early morning  This place is to Scottsdale what King Taco now is to downtown Pasadena - Mexican fast food with lots of options on the menu, cheap, and open late night, as an alternative to expensive restaurants in the area after hours  I've hit the rolled tacos, the chicken nachos plate, and the tortas here  All solid choices! And super cheap! Do leave a tip?

oBmnxdf8UzNL35w0HmmkeQ.text: Despite the annoying construction happening right in front of this place, there is always a line in the drive thru and the staff are quick to move through it. I've been here so many times I've tried just about everything on the menu. The breakfast burritos are my favorite. The carnitas burrito is very good and filled with a hearty amount of meat. The green chile burrito is also another favorite. You won't be disappointed! Fyi, its nothing fancy. Prices are totally reasonable and service is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hopefully you can see the enormity of this carnitas burrito! The green sauce is where it&#39;s at my friends! Double up!

fHNJjN9bVBMoEMjh_46xYA.text: I stopped in yesterday for a breakfast burrito.  I went with the bacon and it was great. Huge, filling and tasty. Oh yeah, and it was only $5. The green salsa was kinda weak - really watery.

S7nNXCDXs8CIP6qx-TFYdQ.text: Being from Chicago and Mexican American it's kind of sad that AZ doesn't even come close to Chicago Mexican food and AZ is bordering Mexico. Yes the portions are big but more food doesn't mean better. I rather have a smaller portion with some genuine Mexican food taste. The carne asada has no type of flavor. Meat looks discolored or something and has just a bland taste that honestly if it wasn't for the guacamole I probably would have thrown my burrito away. I have seriously thought about opening my own Mexican Taqueria because unfortunately these places are just like the rest. Filiberto's, Julioberto's or any other Bertos in PHX. I can honestly say that Street tacos fair a lot better but not by a lot. What I've noticed is that all these places get cheap meat and ingredients to cut down on cost but the quality of the food is what suffers. The one star was for the guacamole which I can also make better myself but helped the burrito survive as I was hungry and beggars can't be choosers. Also real Mexican food doesn't have yellow cheese. You might as well go to Taco Bell. Shame on you and any place using yellow cheese.

XkU3FB5T9WeH355LkcGNSQ.text: I ordered machaca beef enchiladas with rice and beans on the side and I received a huge plate of deliciousness. Four stars because the machaca beef was mixed with veggies and the proportion was not my preference (more veggies than meat ugh). But overall the food tasted good and it was inexpensive. I'm definitely coming here again.

ioh45W4iHqOiYFGjGz-RcQ.text: This is way better then any of the "oritos" places around town. Friendly, fast and great food. Salsa bar had both red and green sauce, limes and a fantastic selection of pickled hot carrots, jalepenos and onions. Had the carne asada California style and the potatoes they put in the borrito were amazing.  I will be back.

4L6fOoIiii0lGX34xgB5vQ.text: They are awesome. I love the food, the people are friendly, service is quick, and the food is relatively cheap for how much they give you. I go there whenever I can and never regret it. I'm only doing 4 stars because they have messed up one or two orders of mine in the past but not nearly enough to make me stop going. :)

3N0HeQfgOWCfj3xAAiw4Gw.text: Sub Par at best, Carne Asada plate two bland pieces of steak, tough and you have to chop it up yourself, the rice is bleh. I live down the street and I thought I would give this place a second chance due to construction on McDowell Rd, I'll continue going to LosBetos from now on. Even the photos on their drive thru menu look bland.

uvEidvGJxJa-vIBNjaGKCw.text: This place is amazing! Hate to share my secret little neighborhood gem but it would be selfish not to. The beans and their family recipe are unmatched. They're always fast and their food is reasonably priced. The girls and I love a lunch at Fiesta!

R1uurVl-s-sOBt_Pj9MSrA.text: Tasty burritos for around $4 each.    They do have a drive thru, but most people get stuck sitting in it for quite a while.  They only have 4-5 parking spaces, so just be aware.

KcmZFmNVmsLpJOOmE3pMCw.text: Good food bad customer service. Food is what I expect from a drive thru Mexican food place, but definitely not the best of its kind (Los favoritos). Drive thru people seem to not care about you at all. Also the potatoes in the California carne asada burritos differ depending on what time you go there.

lq_JmUTqndJcnjgkFVTuUw.text: I've been coming to Fiesta Burrito for months now, and the food is always good. From the breakfast burritos, to the various entrees, the food always hits the spot. It's not exceptional, but there is never a wait, and I know I can always count on getting my Mexican food fix here, and that makes me happy.

4rEeOZL5JkcYZK7DQQGaow.text: I always love the small local Mexican restaurants around town. This one is good but nit favorite. I only go there for the breakfast burritos and they are amazing. They are under $5 and are twice the size you will get at any fast food restaurant. I also like how they are not dripping with grease like others. I was unimpressed with the inside of the restaurant and the worker who took my order was not very nice and didn't smile at all. I usually do the drive thru and it is quick and easy. This place is better then filibertos and is great for breakfast or a quick snack.

wUUFrC1WcSCq8ZZcl3K5vg.text: Little places like this are the best! If you didn't grow up in Arizona you may be freaked out by the actual building Fiesta Burrito is in, but as a native I know these are the best places! I ordered the plan bean and cheese burro for $3 and it was delicious! The service was so fast and the workers were very kind! My mom and I were in the area the next day and I told her she should stop and get a burro so we did! She loved hers too.

2sEVaBKz6bQOgOvZaouBSg.text: This is place is like the average berto's type Mexcian fast food. The staff is very friendly. They also cook the food fresh which leads to a great hot meal. Location is ok and not to hard to get into. Though sometimes there is a long line in the drive through. Sometimes it also takes a while to get your food.

BpIhL3RBjvsvjDAFIDENcQ.text: How the eff have I not reviewed this place already?   I love the bean & cheese burrito from Fiesta Burrito so much that I want to roll around with it naked. OK, I really just want to put it on my mouth, but in a really sexy way.   This review might say more about my sex life than a burrito, but really drive to Fiesta immediately & get one. It's will be the best bean burrito you've ever eaten. If you disagree with me, then you should drive to Taco Bell for all your bean burrito needs. Your palette is obviously not refined enough for Fiesta Burrito.  Yeah they have a whole other menu of other stuff too, but why would I bother, when I can get a bean and cheese burrito?

2PaTk8LsiXbfiF5kui2hTw.text: Excellent price, service and food.  I'm not sure about some of the low reviews here.  I rarely review any place but this is a little gem that deserves to be noticed.  I have had 2 different types of the breakfast burrito and the shredded beef chimichanga. and have enjoyed every last bite.  Love this place!!!

kl6b-ZdbMRb7guDCCMdp2g.text: I was visiting from Los Angeles and wanted some authentic mexican food and did not find it here. the food was bland, flavorless. Never again. Ugh messed up my night .

D_IZTIyRQ512ZhktO0s_Sg.text: I'm not exactly sure why, but Fiesta Burrito blows away the 'somebody-bertos' which are all over the valley.  My first clue that this place would be better than the average was seeing the fire truck and ambulance parked outside. Firefighters are typically great cooks, and if they are eating at a place, it is a great sign.  My most recent visit, I was hungry, in a hurry, and wanted something tasty. I was in the area and hit Fiesta Burrito. I got a carne asada burro and a plain cheese crisp. Even though the line of cars was six deep, the line moved smoothly and before I knew it, I was paying for my lunch.  Getting back to the office, I was pleased to discover a tasty burro and the cheese crisp was very good. Please note, this is not America's or Gallo, but it is good in a pinch. As a bonus, you're eating at a place called 'Party Burrito'! How can you lose?  Give it a shot, you will not be disappointed.

pEYlBEMUvhdntleduqwlMg.text: Over the lips, past the gums, look out stomach here it comes!!!! For a fast food Mexican Food joint, I have to say this one is pretty tasty! I LOVE their Super Nachos! They also have decent tacos and yummy rice and beans. If you don't catch them when they are busy) you don't always get the freshest ingredients, as in sometimes I have had stale chips, or the meat wasn't as good as it usually is...... so try hitting this place during the normal B,L and D time rush. Also if you're looking for a late night snack, this place is open 24/7 so being able to stuff your face with pretty decent Mexican Food, is better than no food at all :) I have to say I will keep visiting Fiesta Burrito rather than their competition! They are better than FillyB's and close to my bf house! Alway a plus when we feel like grabbing something quick! I just wish they would stop being delicious sometimes and meh the next! Consistency is nice!

Es54MJT3jzJr5CnTtPVlpw.text: Needed a snack for my toddler son and this place came through. Friendly and fast drive-thru, great tortillas and flavorful pulled chicken.

X8Nan29Z4ZMEub5sN87Ksg.text: Once again, went through the drive through. I do not know where the owner is or if he even works in the restaurant. Owner needs to teach or educate his workers how to say thank you, thanks for your business, please come back. The workers don't even know how to ask for your order. They are not very friendly, if you ask for a certain number of their watered down sauce, they rolled their eyes. When you give your debit card, they act like they wanted cash. The food is not that great for such lousy service. Too many burrito places that would love the business. Last time I will be going there. Parking lot was empty at the time, maybe other people share the same feeling as I do. Employees need to remember, it's the company that cuts the check, but the customer who pays you. Without customers, you're out of a job.

hONfOVBNOiFaSN8mMBmlcw.text: Addictive and Amazing! My boyfriend loves hole-in-the-wall places that scare me. So I looked on yelp for places one day so I could find him a well reviewed one. The rest was history. My boyfriend lived in LA for 10 years (known for excellent food) and he is living there temporarily right now. He says the carne asada burrito is the best he has ever had anywhere. One day he flew back home and when I picked him up from the airport at 10pm he asked to go to Fiesta Burrito. The last time he came back he drove from LA and stopped at Fiesta before even coming to see me and I only see him two weekends per month!  I don't eat beef so my favorite is the adobada burrito. They also have the best refried beans I have had in many years.   Be careful if you go - because you will want to go back again and again. I liked the guys review about running the marathon and wanting to stop. My boyfriend would have been right there with you!!!

z1IOo7k0qAbUVcr4SBJW3g.text: Cheap, delicious, and greasy. If that's not a winning combination for a fast food Mexican joint, I don't know what is. Yes, it's pretty similar to Filiberto's and Los Favoritos and Julioberto's and all the other "berto's" around the valley, but Fiesta Burrito shines a bit brighter than most of those in the taste category. I don't live particularly close to this location, but I can promise that whenever I'm nearby it's going to be a huge temptation. Yum.

tKoa1MLxAtfeKstPaVM-JA.text: Not as good as I had hoped for. Not horrible, but I just moved over to this area from San Diego a week ago and was looking for a little mexican shop on par with everywhere in SD. Yes, I know I am not in SD anymore so I can't expect the same thing. If I were to have found this place there I would have rated it as a generous 2 stars.  But again overall I just had better expectations for a 4.0 rating with over 130 votes.

vsXKVz5xaMLB8dcd9fddaA.text: The best breakfast burritos!  Granted, I've never ordered anything else, and it's only one of many items on their menu, but those breakfast burritos ROCK!  Add condiments/sauces of your choice, and you're starting your day right!  Very clean, very friendly and VERY inexpensive!  Try it! You'll like it!

qUXh3suhkj3j5lOE-Q0TjQ.text: Best breakfast burrito in the south Scottsdale area. I eat a shit load of breakfast burritos so trust me on this one. Very reasonable prices as well.

d7jZimkSKxIufh6_Klh5BA.text: Rudest Manager. Screw this place! I ordered 2 red sauces and 1 green with my taco... There's alot of meat that needs sauce. And the sauce is good. But over the loudspeaker after I made my order, I asked for the extra sauce and he immediately scoffed, "For 1 TACO?!" How are you going to judge me for ordering what I want? And since you charge for the xtra sauce you're actually making more money!  I decide to let it go. I go back today for my same order. Different teller on the speaker, but that a-hole was outside breaking down boxes and he had a head set. I finished my order at the speaker, looked up to see him. He locked eyes with me and shook his head... WTF?!!!!!  I got my food and confronted him. "You got a problem with my sauce?!" "For 1 taco?"  "How you going to judge me for liking and Paying for your food?"   "......" "F*** you and your taco!" I wouldn't tolerate this from any business trying to earn my money. Fiesta Burrito is on blast. Screw these guys. There food isn't worth this kind of attitude

c3vyWSlP-tZ3fIspX2utQw.text: If you're looking for a gourmet Mexican food experience then Fiesta Burrito isn't your place. However, if you're looking for good food served up quickly then this is the place for you.   Fiesta Burrito is my go to spot when I'm craving burritos for lunch. It's close to my work, open late and affordable priced. The parking and seating are limited but never seem to be an issue when I go. If you don't want to get out of your car, drive-thru is also available.  If you find yourself at Fiesta Burrito make sure you take full advantage of the salsa bar!
