Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combo menu cont.
Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Four rolled taco combo

j9MHFaBa49gwzRzQVQsFVA.text: I stopped by here a few weeks ago and went through the drive thru. I ordered: 3 rolled tacos with cheese and guac 2 carne asada tacos carne asada fries 2 chilli relleno enchilidas 1 large Pepsi It was a lot of food for what I spent. The food was tasty and the employees were nice. I will be back for more grub in the future.

rB3mekWWNAGfKbCfKtPamw.text: Fiesta has been my saving grace on one many night outs it's close to our place and we do end up eating here most weekends during those late night cravings. one thing i love is the california burrito with the pickled carrots and jalapenos you can also switch it up and make it a vegetarian fare.  The burrito is loaded which shredded chicken, generous helpings but they are a bit stingy with the potatoes and pico de gallo. salsa is very watered down especially the green one, the red is a little better and spicier be sure to ask for extra.  They have drive thru definite plus the portions are generous for prices.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cali Burrito

AhiqZST3-Xgtoo2h9aeTrA.text: I Love this place . Best ever Carne  Asada burritos . Chimichangas are great too , Beef are better than the Chicken though. Their Cheese Quesadillas are huge and have lots of cheese on them. Rolled Tacos are good , Tacos are good too . Also the Bean and Cheese Burritos are big for the price. I can't say much negative about this place. I guess the place could use a face lift to the building but then the prices will probably go up & my Daughter will be so sad if that happens cuz she Loves the $9 Carne Sad-a chips entree . If it goes up to $10 she might not buy it anymore. All in all this fast food Mexican place is the best in our area. Keep up the good work you hard working Cooks & ect . others working there. Good job !

bgZECNrH7RRsuRGxK7gqKw.text: Growing up in AZ you always have places like this as a go to breakfast burrito/taco place. This place is great for exactly what it is, my husband and I love the bacon and egg with cheese breakfast burrito. The bacon is cut up so it's incorporated into every bit. I used to order the sausage, egg and cheese but found I liked the bacon better.   I also like their traditional breakfast burrito that comes with shredded pork, pick de Gallo, egg and cheese but it doesn't keep for too long since the pick de gallo can make the tortilla soggy if it sits too long.   My family from Chicago have gotten their enchiladas and really liked them. I'm picky about those but they were pretty good if you have a craving. Loved their refried beans. Their rolled tacos are also excellent.   If we do dinner I order the carne asada burrito with guacamole. It's my go-to at places like this, that and shredded beef tacos.   The breakfast burritos aren't greasy but other items like shredded beef tacos are. Its just part of anyplace like this, Fiesta isn't overly greased by any means.

OyODeeRusjmbifwAAbg7eg.text: The food is excellent but the place is a bit dirty and the owner controls the soda fountain with a switch behind the counter. If you try to get a refill of soda without paying, he loses his mind. Hence the switch behind the counter. He also gets very upset if you use a lot of hot sauce and tells you that you need to pay him more for it.

HzCqQTA4eWmGhLe0xRXpiw.text: I usually only come here during drill weekends, and oh my gosh is it good. The only con is the drive thru can take a really long time. Other than that, great breakfast burritos!

_9_geBb6GQsxaj5vvrnv2Q.text: I'm a taco shop lover, there's just nothing like it when you think about other food options. Fiesta Burrito might be on favorite taco shop in AZ, it always hits the spot and they're incredibly consistent.  I recommend the beef tacos, they're so bomb! The California burrito is really good also, as are the carne asada fries.  This is a very straight forward spot, they have a drive-thru as well which usually goes pretty quick! This area of Scottsdale is lacking in food options, so if you're in the area check it out.

fYzrkP-CrSpIijc0FPq44A.text: Fast Mex!  Although I mostly come for 1 thing, this my 2nd time in a month. It doesn't hurt that I live close by or that they're open late, especially on weekends. But as a result of surveying 10 local restaurants, this by far is a best value gem in south Scottsdale.  We are talking Chili  Rellenos! 1, you get 2. 2, they taste good 3, the combo is enough to feed a horse! The beans are slightly Smokey and of course, salty. The rice is typical, and not much to say about it except it tastes good and, none of that frozen peas and carrots junk.  No problem with the green sauce smother request.   The place is always clean, smells like pinesol and has a decent chilled salsa bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. C h i l i &#39; s  R e l l e n o s con salsa verde

F-mnddKWFv6dOtLUs6fhXg.text: I'm just not a fan of Fiesta Burrito. I've been here a few times in my lifetime and every time I hope it was just the previous experience that was bad.   That is not the case. It's just not my favorite. On this particular visit I think I expected to get an enchilada combo with two chicken enchiladas but if I recall correctly, that isn't an option.   Instead, I had one enchilada and one taco with rice and beans. I had a difficult time differentiating between the taco and the enchilada. Either because my taco had become so soft the way it was packaged into the container or because they were basically the same thing and everything just tastes the same?   I don't know, it wasn't great. It did not cure my craving for enchiladas but reminded me of why I haven't gone here more frequently. I guess it's just not the same type of Mexican food I'm used to.

hDs3W7bWmsBtErY4vWhQTg.text: Food poisoning. Holy mother of God. I have been here a million times. A million. I went to Coronado. I came by late last night and ordered a burrito and didn't even eat the whole thing. I ate half. It was the only thing I had eaten yesterday because I had a ridiculous day at work. I woke up early this morning with the most hellacious stomach aches. Felt like my stomach was being twisted. I was sick in the bathroom for a few hours. Just awful. I wish I could say it had been anything else but I know it was Fiesta because it's the only thing I consumed yesterday. I am so sad. I love this place. Definitely won't be back now. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cSnBraXjOoo-cVwZc_wydw.text: This place is perfect for your late night burrito crazvings. 1230 in the morning? Get ya a chimichanga and horchata, no prob.   It's not 5 star gourmet. But it is quick and simple Mexican food.

D-jzDmeKjf5jxTpup9kt4w.text: I used to live near this place and ever since I moved I crave it. I will end up using my entire list lunch break to drive here from work and eat in my car while I drive back. The ONLY thing I would change about this place is the order that they stack ingredients on entrees. Everyone knows that cheese goes on hot items like chips and rolled tacos FIRST and then other toppings like guacamole and sour cream. This is so the cheese will melt and provide a layer to keep moisture from toppings from seeping in to chips and other crunchy items and keep them from getting soggy. For example rolled tacos, then cheese, then guacamole. This is the only thing keeping Fiesta Burrito from a five star review.    They are open late  They are fast  They are friendly   They are clean  They stack ingredients in entrees in a way that allows them to become soggy

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Get better @ stacking ingredients: chips, then chz, then meat, then sc, then pico. This keeps the chips from becoming soggy &amp; melts the chz.

x6-shJP9-6JDM24IBhqChQ.text: Not bad I would absolutely recommend this place if you need a chili relleno burrito the only problem is they serve Pepsi. It's a great late night option

5l7vIPNEkk-cTWld4jT5Fw.text: Really?  6 dollars for an egg cheese bean burrito ???? And they forget the egg and throw in potatoes.  Idiots

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not my order

F5D378Q4ZQ-YUGXMVEyTEQ.text: I've been coming here for years and it's very good! But lately they need to step up their game! Just last night I ordered a bacon egg and cheese burrito with a side of rice and beans and they literally gave me beans and a whole side of pico??? Literally no rice? Step it up fiesta.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hbSbczE9gREBuk-zalEOhQ.text: If you don't like Mexican food, please stop reading and unfriend me now .  Fiesta Burrito is nearby to my work, is open 24 hours, and has a drive through. It resembles other "Berto"-style establishments,  which are fast food type Mexican fare. The staff is friendly,  and the older gentleman at the front always knows it is me by my order. They are also PD friendly, which is a plus.  The restaurant inside is clean. There is a small salsa bar that is never empty. I have never used the bathroom, so I can't vouch for that. Sometimes the parking lot van get difficult. There aren't many spots,  and sometimes the line at the drive through can block other traffic through the lot. The drive through goes pretty fast, so it is never a problem for long.   The food is always hot and fresh. I have had breakfast, country, bean and cheese and Chile relleno burritos. I also have gotten macho fries, super nachos, chicken tacos, rice, beans and rolled tacos (taquitos).  They have agua fresca as well as sodas. I normally get a jamaica. I have liked everything here. The prices are fairly inexpensive.  If you are in a hurry, are headed home from the club or just want a good lunch for a good price, give Fiesta a try.

awnCytN-06YalNu0Fx1bOQ.text: Love this place!!!  Not perfect every time but pretty close.  Love the beef chimichanga, Super nachos, chili rellenos, shredded beef tacos, carne asada tacos, machaca!!!  Pretty much anything containing their machaca or carne asada is good.  Great breakfast burritos and decent carnitas. My son and I clearly eat here way too often.   One day I'll take a pic... as soon as I get the food I forget.

10-O_zuqY1gaATigvzh-4A.text: Was exactly what the 3-star rating says, A-ok.  The carne asada burrito was nothing spectacular but the adobada taco was pretty decent. The food in general was acceptable and nothing too polarizing but it really doesn't hold up to great Mexican like Don Pepe's back home (just as cheap) or in the Bay area.  Its saving grace may be its cheap price but I'll be looking elsewhere.

bicSvnxmA0Slqc36ktX8-A.text: Amazing breakfast burritos! Heat up so well the next day, go here at least once a week!

Ne_N7tfI70xH0reMkRXI0A.text: I really like Fiesta Burrito. When my Husband suggested we go here, I was a little nervous because it looks a little bit sketchy. When we went inside, it was pretty clean. The staff was really nice and accommodating when I ordered at the window, asking for no cheese and this and that. I got a Bean Tostada and Bean Taco.  Everything is made fresh, and tastes that way. I really enjoyed the Rice as well.  Their Pico is really onion heavy, but it balances well with the food. I also like their Green Salsa.  I will say, I'm not sure if their beans or rice are vegetarian. I'm sort of "if I don't have to chew it, I don't know it is there" vegetarian, so enter with caution if you aren't this way.  The meal really didn't feel greasy or too guilty, even though I'm sure it was!

DivaapIZ1qvcxuIke_IPcw.text: So the place looks super sketch from the outside and the staff could care less about you as a human BUT not gonna lie, the food is pretty, pretty, pretty good. I always get chicken tacos with rice beans and make sure you get the red and green sauce

0MbqSx6vwI2qTahSp14bpg.text: What an amazing portion, quality and pricing! The Carne asada and guacamole is so good!   A must try!

_2lXPvWBejezi-3RJ4Hcmg.text: I'm drooling just thinking about how good this place is. The food is fresh and the cooks work so fast. If a Unicorn and Filiberto's had a baby, it would be this place.

5ZFiSss_lP31fEkgfu3Awg.text: Got 2 breakfast burritos with egg shells in them. Normally a good place but this is unacceptable.

u-zwV5pYmTP8UO5NsvF2Ag.text: Great carne asada chimi, combo #20, crispy and flavorful.  Lots of Guacamole too.  The staff were laughing and singing in the back, great place and I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uvExRgrN7VW9gpi5RngHxg.text: I love this place. So much.  Ever since Texano's in Tempe closed, Fiesta Burrito has been my go-to place for adobada burritos. A side of sour cream is a necessity with the adobada burrito and they give you a good portion for the price. I also like lots of pico and they have a big container of it inside at the salsa bar.  The machaca plate with egg (#11) is my second favorite. I always use the accompanying tortilla to make my own burrito, plus I get the rice and beans on the side. Yum.  The quesadilla supreme is also very good, but I would recommend eating it with a fork and knife, they really load it up.  Overall, I have never had anything bad from Fiesta and the staff is always super friendly. Plus there's a drive-thru. Awesome!

JYx3Qi0uKNXZVjdO3hu6HQ.text: Was a big fan of fiasta burrito but when my sister and her gf (she happens to be African American) went in to get something to eat you can tell they felt uncomfortable and made us feel uneasy. They just kept giving altitude and rolling there eyes. At one point we can hear them comment in the back saying racial slurs in spanish since were mexican also. I just cant go back if they are prejudice and homophopic and if thats how they run business then we're jusy going to take our business else where.  Update-went again to get something to drink since it was hot and too see if they changed but guess not So I talked about fiasta burrito before but damn man dont go at night for drinks. Just went to get a small horchata and a large and the guy end up giving me 2 large which isn't a big deal but then before I took off I noticed one was purple so I went back literally seconds later pretty much went around the restaurant still in there parking lot and the guy was like "what do you want"(really man) and I said "hey man I asked for 2 horchatas and he went on the offense and said "NO YOU SAID 1 HORCHATA AND 1 JAMAICA LOOK AT YOUR RECEIPT". then I went um no 1st I asked for 1 large and 1 small and you end giving me two large with no receipt which I dont mind but you didn't give two horchatas and then he went on by okay but I need to charge you and I said wth why i didn't ask for that order then he was like fine pull up and he end giving me my drink but with the craziest altitude. I was more shocked then mad like wtf man it was the easiest order ever and I didn't snap at him or get mad. Idk why he was so mad

jzrLi5EMuw1jj2xSSElteA.text: slightly better then most mexican joints, fresher too. Only wish it was open later. be sure to tip them =D.

v-VtMOHFLwApTuVuKl2q-A.text: After moving from San Diego, where I could find some of the most delicious Mexican food it took me a while to stumble upon great tasting mexican food in Arizona. This place has really good quality food but the portions are on the small side especially for burritos.

DL_KX-sNx7BNFvbs88KuVQ.text: Ordered 4 tacos with only cilantro and onion and 4 flautas with chips and salsa with two small cokes and I received 4 tacos with guacamole and pico de gallo.. And two large drinks "diets" cokes also the chips and salsa was chips and pico de gallo

YigyCmoHTN-BoMQ7s8dXAg.text: Awesome place! Delicious! The staff is always friendly too! The best part is, that sometimes I'm craving some good Mexican but it's after dinner time...well guess what?! They are open late! One of my favorite dishes is the rolled tacos. It comes with guacamole, need I say more?

LU24WUqGsL3dozqMxXJdCw.text: I wanted something different from my original lunch meal. So, on my lunch break I drove by this place. I pulled in and "California"  It was an good burrito, it taste almost the same burrito served at Filibertos.

tWY29u8FK9V_GpjIzOPauQ.text: Had a super delicious shredded beef burrito and rolled tacos.  If I lived nearby I would definitely try every burrito on the menu.  The tortilla was fresh and hot, killer.  Good beans and rice.  The cheese enchilada was OK but not on the same level.

S2zX58ogKx6Mwu9XstLWWQ.text: Quick, cheap and utterly DELICIOUS.  I regularly visit Fiesta Burrito to curb my desire for (you guessed it) a big ol' burrito. You can get a huge plate of tasty Mexican food here for only a few dollars. And your food is usually ready in less than three minutes. I'm being serious. This place is gold.  Try their chimichanga plate or the rolled tacos with guacamole, and order a "pina" drink to go along with it. It's great for lunch, dinner or midnight snacking.

Cd4kbaLRb3uK0iplqksDaw.text: This was very good carne asada, especially for fast food!  Only complaint was it was a little on the salty side.  Still gave them 4 stars.  :)  * I had the Carne Asada burrito with guacamole.

3gKkA02BtBMraIgt4pQXjA.text: Best drive thru mexican food in scottsdale by far. Good for lunch or late night eats. All the staff are great and a fun atmosphere if you decide to sit down in the small dining area. Although small they have a good salsa bar. My favorite is the chile relleno burrito and the steak ranchero breakfast

ei3mGLJt99yfQJThqbRbag.text: Fiesta Burrito has the best Mexican food in South Scottsdale! I usually use the drive thru. It's quick even when the line is long. Their burritos are amazing along with their SUPER NACHOS!! I highly recommend going to fiesta when your hungry for quick Mexican food.

MPOyi3EcnatAMkK7Wfic7g.text: The food is great here!  I stop here for breakfast & lunch often. This is not a filabertos. Great food, price & service!

ScTEatd36sH0do25tuVTjg.text: This place is just Okay. It's close to my house so I've eaten here quite a few times. The best items I've had are the breakfast burritos, they actually are pretty good and available all day.  My biggest issue with this place is the meat. When you order something with meat on it, they do put a lot on there but, its just not that good. The chicken is always tough, stringy and chewy. The carnitas is an odd consistency, more like chipped beef, not like the shredded/pulled pork consistency it should be and its very greasy. The carne asada is tough but the best meat option (besides the bacon) in my opinion.  The pico de gallo is mostly cilantro, way too much for my tastes but if you like cilantro you'll love their pico.

8F4jFZ2l1h2bC4DrsFdcoA.text: Not impressed. Food lacked flavor. Wouldn't go back.  Had better Mexican food back home

iNkc6vjNzYva0MkHDrKgVw.text: If you like mexican food try this place. The food is awesome and for a decent price.  You really cant go wrong here. They have a salsa bar and the service is fast like speedy Gonzales fast.

hsrn_z9xZk_NTg3_LiHoeQ.text: The California burrito and chimichanga are the best I've experienced in Arizona so far.  They also have awesome salsas which I seem to grab way more than I need when I'm there.  My only complaints are going to be the lack of seating, the length of time it takes to get your food sometimes and the clerk can be extremely rude.  So I've chosen to get it to go and make sure I'm not on a time restraint when picking up food here.  Also, the burritos are smaller than the ones I'n used to, but they're cheaper too!

mm7sv4YKxIk4xrZKNroJvw.text: Hands down best breakfast burritos around! The service is pretty quick and they have a nice salsa bar inside for you to fill your own containers. The weekends get a little busy with the National Guard base soldiers out to eat, but it's worth the wait! I wouldn't recommend a plain bean and cheese burrito as it's very flavorless. Parking is ample with Pepsi products on the fountain!

LD7MBFUS2q3ut3ipcfC0rQ.text: Based on other reviews, I may have had higher expectations than I should, but this place is really not very good. Had the carne asada burrito with rice and beans. Carne asada had almost no flavor or char (appeared to be boiled? Yuck!) Which they attempted to mask with guac and pico. Beans and rice were sub par and bland as well. Meal came out in the time it took to fill my soda, which isn't a good sign.   If you want good, quality, flavorful Mexican food look elsewhere. The only real positive is that it was fast and inexpensive. I won't be coming back.

pDdMMeqhKh-prdjh1xkHPw.text: I told the owner there was too much salt in the carne asada meat from time to time. Instead of providing good customer service and talking to me, he said I was the only one that ever complained about it. This is not True. I have at least 2 friends who eat and have the same complaint. Horrible customer service, especially coming from the owner. By the way, I have been going there for 4 or 5 years.

RGebLQ1AVCKtq21BJVpyWQ.text: Fiesta Burrito has the best tasting chorizo burrito that I've had anywhere - and for a price that is unmatched - $4.75 including tax.  We need a location in Mesa - please. :-)

7xeT6rgZo987hhcXJOK9mg.text: I'm from Southern California and I love burritos . Moved to arizona about a month ago and live right next to fiesta burrito . I love California burritos and they have a good one with good red and green salsa .   Wish the burrito was alittle thicker and the fries not as moist but other than that I will be a regular there for as long as I live here .

_W5izCex4eW2Fn7UlmffBw.text: Best drive through Mexican food in Scottsdale. I go out of my way for this place. I used to live down the street from this little gem. I would pass by everyday and assume that it was. A typical burrito stand serving mostly stomach aches and loose stools. One (late) evening on the way home from old town we stopped for something to soak up the bourbon. What happened that night was magical. This would be no one night (burrito) stand.  Fiesta burrito, translation: party of meat, beans, and rice in a blanket, is in fact, amazing.  It servers your very typical Mexican food. Burritos of all sorts, rolled tacos, etc. The difference is that deist prepares things freshly and they do it well.  I now live ~ 20 miles from fiesta. Thankfully I work one day a week in Tempe and go out of my way on the ride home to stop by.  My favorites:  The breakfast burritos: I usually go for the sausage and egg but they are all great. Simple and made fresh.  The carnitas burrito. My cracking. Juicy pork with pico and guac. Hits the spot every time.  The carne asada burrito. Much better than other places I have found around Phoenix. Spicy and savory.  Rolled tacos. Not sure why these are particularly good here but I think it is the Fuad they put on top.  A few months ago at the 5th mile of the of the of changs half marathon, which ran right down McDowell  I almost stopped running to get a burrito. Only the fact that I had no money and the fear of a burrito belly for the next 8 miles kept me going. Next time I'm stopping.

nta0HVwJnfUT2y-rS8EENQ.text: Very fast service and good quality of food! The meat was well seasoned. The portion sizes was large and well worth the prices. Very glade I found this place. Will be one of my favorite Mexican food spots.

Photo of Fiesta Burrito - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super Nachos

g2RSRC9IdkANAeaf8zToQw.text: Reliable late night take out fast mexican food. Usually get taquitos and/or a machaca burrito, its good value & the staff is friendly.

VM03KSAJEbvozBRHAjSQXg.text: We all know Fiesta Burrito has great food, but that's not my issue here. PRICES. They have raised their prices almost comparable to sitting down at a full service dining restaurant. A carne asada burrito, beans and rice combination: $9.28... with the burrito having shrunk in bulk noticeably.  Not sure if they have lost business and are struggling, or if they are hoping to reap the benefits of the new mass apartment complexes going in across the street from them.

kkthNK-sUGc2dpXjWqDLXg.text: I love this places breakfast burritos!  Put some of the red sauce on there and you could skip lunch.

4uPjVLExXhGJchBvI_5oXw.text: Outstanding Mexican fast food.  Always friendly service.  Clean inside and quick with the-drive thru.  Contender for best [fried] fish tacos locally.  Check your drive thru order before leaving if you have special instructions.   Eat here.  A lot.

ZkJKunUw1smZB8YclL-OeA.text: I debated if I should even review this mediocre experience. The reviews make it sound like its a hidden gem, of quality and quantity in the lost art of Mexican cuisine. I found it very bland. It did fill the purpose for which I came here, but compared to some awesome Mexican food that I have had in this so-close-to-Mexico-state - this place was far from note worthy.  It's not expensive, which is the factor that saves this place - but I find the fast food angle of Mexican food incredibly tacky. And the seating arrangement is purposely very small. It is clear that the model is enter-pay-eat-gtfo, and I have no issue with that - but I don't see this as something that I want.  One could compare this to a Mexican franchise, something that in itself is a hilarious strangeness when one is living with so many actual Mexican that can cook amazing things out of mystery meat, lard, flour and chili.

IdG-XA-KI4SAcfYLQwrSow.text: I have been a customer here for years. I love fiesta they have always been very nice. But there is a new girl employee that is very unfriendly and made me feel like I was annoying her. She seemed unhappy ti answer our simple questions. She has blomde hair and dark eyebrows.

4MOBrfJrKrp-JRuL31VPag.text: I really feel the  need to write this review. My husband and I have been going here for 4 yrs. We   ate there once a week. We ordered our usual Im allergic to tomatoes My husband told them no tomatoes on my burrito. I pulled open a little piece of it, tomatoes. No big deal my husband got up told the owner of the mistake he said  in a very rude way no you didnt say no tomatoes!! My husband said yes I did he again corrected my husband. I didnt even take a bite out of it. He didnt offer to make me a new one. All he wanted was to be right. My husband threw out his and my lunch and we left. Never will we be back again. Hope it was worth losing loyal customers.

ZRnh5gZzd-WFoXgmk0uogQ.text: Love Fiesta Burrito! Their California burrito is delicious. Super nachos? Amazing. The beans are so light, fluffy, and flavorful. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because they are super stingy with the hot sauce. I ordered four items the other day and only got two tiny containers of hot sauce. I even asked for extra..offered to pay also. She said okay but obviously didn't give me any more. I love this place, but give me more hot sauce!

FUgVvoW6XzF7fr3dF3gw6w.text: I stumbled across this joint on the Yelp app when I was looking for a new place to try for lunch. I must've driven by this place 1000 times and I've never noticed it....I'm glad Yelp guided me here. It was a Saturday and the place was kind of busy. After browsing the extensive menu on the wall, I decided to order: Carne Asada Burrito, $4.15 yelp.com/biz_photos/fies... Bean and Cheese Burrito, $2.75 yelp.com/biz_photos/fies... While I was waiting for my food, I mozied over to the Salsa Bar to grab a few cups of Salsa. I give their Salsa Bar 2 Stars...because they only have the runny Green & Red Sauces, Pickled Veggies, and Pico de Gallo. There's no chunky Salsa or really hot Salsa available.....the runny Green and Red options are very mild. yelp.com/biz_photos/fies... After a short wait, my Burritos were ready. I went for the Carne Asada first. I took one bite and fell in love with it...it's a little different than most places like this in that they have Potatoes in the Burrito. The Potatoes and Carne Asada create a unique flavor that tastes very good....kudos to them for putting this together! Next was the Bean & Cheese Burrito....that too was very good. Overall, the food here is 4 Stars...it's that good. The lack of a hot Salsa option drops it down to 3.5 Stars, but I'm rounding up because I think they deserve it. Return Factor - 90%

9NvYmSVhedS0bL0Jdxa5jA.text: The food was amazing. Very good quality, impressed with this restaurant. I was in town for a day and found them on here, glad we stopped here for dinner. Great portions and worth the price.

FniU5KY6akYx0WZqhzyB7g.text: When it comes to arizona, everyone knows that filiberto, losbeto and any other buritto shop might be brothers or somehow the same company... but I don't get that feeling when I walk into Fiesta Burrito.  Their breakfast burritos are so good, it's hard to beat especially when it's across the street from Skysong. During Lunch hours this place is always packed. So make sure to time your arrival in a smart manner.  This is also a very good option for the morning after a fun night out as the burritos do a good job of soaking up all the stuff in your body from the night before.  Would recommend.

dhRmzQJXEcOSOowSrXWaSw.text: My husband and I tried this place this morning. We both got breakfast burritos and they were delicious and inexpensive. We will definitely be back again.  Update. We get breakfast burritos here almost every weekend. I love this place! Best breakfast burritos ever.

HMYEzyBEEshtutGq4MtTRQ.text: Awesome fast-food Mexican.  Great service in the drive-thru.  Convenient location.  Nothing else matters

I4J7qhhIZxPbsKTkdooKwQ.text: I typically love coming here, as it has some of the best mex food, for a great price. Any other day I'd give 5 stars.   ...That was, until just this last visit.   The service and quality absolutely lacked. First off, They got my order wrong! Thankfully, they refunded me the extra burrito and gave me the drink i originally ordered instead. The cashier had a sketchy demeanor to him and seemed kinda out of it, maybe he was on something? Idk. I digress, I arrive home and open my food container only to see that they even messed up my "no guac" request! Is this cashier deaf?! Lol. To make things better, I bite in to my food to find another little extra; a toothpick.  I typically don't review stuff, but this trip literally compelled me to go out of my way to get on yelp and express what happened. The place is great, but tonight sucked.   2 stars; but because the food is so great, 3.

rMAwHmZxMeqKaYo0EsmTjw.text: Love this place so freaking much! They are super cheap, delicious, and they never get my order wrong. Filly B's is lame compared to this place. I've lived in Phoenix my whole life, and I spent many of those years eating at all the "bertos" of the valley. This is definitely my favorite spot for cheap Mexican right now.

rchwJLSRicDNxnrjHMTLqg.text: This place is great, the carne asada is the best from any restaurant at any price that I have been to in AZ NM CA OR or TX. Nice people convenient location. The tortillas are excellent.

WjrXGFijTMgdG1EGAxoCmQ.text: Love this place for a quick bite to eat, no matter what time of day! Really great portions of protein in the selections so you end up full and satisfied! Also a very friendly staff!

zC-XVaNGazxlTDjPYncy_Q.text: I tried their chicken enchiladas and haven't moved on from there. The sauce has a little extra smokey flavor that I love. Definitely a lot of food for very little. Their chorizo burrito is good too. I've tried their fish taco, chimichunga and carnitas plate which was better than average, but not as good as some others. The service has always been fast, friendly and restaurant appears clean.

ZPtn2nEJzxl6hdBaik8ukQ.text: Best hangover cure in Scottsdale! Delicious breakfast burritos... if you're looking for tasty Mexican food in a hurry this is your spot! Great choice for late night or early morning drive thru

4ZpQI8l4tCGWhskst0yDCg.text: Stopped in for lunch from a meeting at the Papago Military Reservation,check on yelp and saw this place was down the road. Small place but very welcoming, I got the chicken taco plate. Chicken was nice and tender but the beans was what got me it was cooked perfect most places are always undercooked. Next time I'm in the area again I'll be sure to be back.

ugsbbQ1MfWfMrtNu64VrlQ.text: Ok, this is the best of the fast burrito joints around town. You know, all those berto places, this beats them hands down. If you live in or around Old Town, you need to get yourself a late night burrito from this place pronto. Although, if you don't know about it yet, I'm not really sure I can get on board with your life choices thus far. Who are you?

mps7U4oDXOoU80Hs32_DrQ.text: This is my go-to place for quick breakfast burritos. I either get the standard with eggs, ham, cheese and pico or the machaca with shredded beef, eggs, and cheese. Both come with sides of red or green sauce. The tortillas have a nice texture and all of the ingredients are cooked together for an overall great distribution of egg:cheese:meat. They'll even toss potatoes in the mix if you ask.   Watch out because these burritos are hot and tend to leak just a tad. They're big too, so you only need one. Check these guys out next time you're sobering up from a long night or if you're craving one of the best breakfast burritos I've ever had.   They offer drive-thru and sit down. If you eat inside, they have a small salsa bar.

IZJVUaleRhGNWfUnI4KOJQ.text: Shredded beef nachos hit the spot for a late night craving. I have enjoyed coming to this place for years. The employees are friendly and helpful.

zxnlumYQHEL8-eG4oThtrg.text: Fiesta Burrito! I love you but you forgot my sausage breakfast burrito when I went through the drive through right now.  I know, it's partly my fault but that sausage burrito is real missed right now.

sGZ67MveXGTE7PHNABxL7Q.text: I have been going here for about 10 years and it has always been awesome!  Really good service and good food...there is a reason its usually busy!  There is also consistency in the employees which I like to see also.

G0o8i-Zc4e-KobHqMAS8FA.text: My boyfriend and I come here on average once a week.  We have our favorite menu items and they never disappoint.  Consistently delicious.   Service is friendly and fast.

LFAZSAzyw9NKFW6KPauAMQ.text: Pretty good and a generous amount of food for fast food. The chips and salsa are huge. I got carne asada tacos which were amazing. I'm full I couldn't eat all of it. Happy I tried the place out it's right down the street from mi casa!

uJQSgdu_JHiZKve0CsamYA.text: If you want good quality mexican fast food at a low price this is the place for you. I especially love their breakfast burritos, they are amazing! My two favorites are the Country burrito and the steak egg and cheese burrito. The carne asada nachos are also very good. The salsa bar is great also. I highly recommend this place! Trust me im Mexican :)

3Moibjw6IIQK7YvojsaJMQ.text: Definitely a True hole-in-the-wall Mexican food joint with the classic washed out pictures of what you are going to be eating on the menu board. I ordered the 4 rolled tacos with guac and had a great meal overall.  Expect large portions, good prices and authentic offerings.  With a good Mexican cerveza the experience would have been even better (I guess I have to go for take-out next time to get the cerveza myself)

DaFThIkWefFLQILBV1Jg3g.text: Always do the drive through when in a hurry to grab a carne asada burrito and go. Ask for extra limes. Huge burrito so I usually split it!

j1Z1PPWPGfRRMkZ8LKS6Dw.text: Came here today to grab a quick lunch on my way into the office.   I picked one of their combos (#6) it came with a shredded beef burrito, cheese enchilada and rice and beans.  I did not eat the enchilada but I did really enjoy the burrito and some of the beans.  Really... you cannot beat this price $5.83!!!  The burrito had shredded beef, a little bit of green peppers and I think I saw little pieces of potato, it was very tasty!  I would definitely come back here again.

UKvohakf3kz9I-69H3GyxQ.text: Just had a carne asada burrito. It was ready in about a minute and was awesome!

Oj1_vED1Y6rkBXZAkwop_Q.text: I ordered the 5 fried tacos. The filling was a little bland, at first I couldn't tell if it was shredded chicken or beef. It was OK. If I go back I'd would try a different dish. That's a big IF.

FYyRp33cJvwojzY-TITzSA.text: This place is pretty awesome.  I've been twice, and have been satisfied both times.  It's cheap, clean, authentic?, mexican food....Yum.   First time I went I ordered way too much...two tacos and a burrito, i finished probably half.  The burrito was ginormous.  The second time I went with  my girlfriend and ordered 2 enchiladas.  The enchiladas were cheap (like under 4 bucks) and good.    The people at this establishment are very nice as well.  Order lightly, the portions are huge.   Nice hole in the wall.  Thanks YELP! for letting me know about this one.

mfvb0C3zqA1VhVPmaRTGhw.text: For fast cheap Mexican food this place is the best! Super nachos with machaca, fantastic! Mixed burrito, amazing! Adovada, delish! Any of the tortas, top notch! The portions are great for the price and the ingredients are good quality.

kJRc3sQB7WmT4gAfDf8ZKg.text: Wow, I can't stop going to this place!  I have to get on here and comment on a couple of new menu items I've tried.  Recently tried the Adobada and the Carnitas burritos - both were fantastic.  Pork and guacamole is always a great combo.  And the Steak and Chorizo Burrito is the stuff of legends.  No joke - this thing is amazing!  It's pretty much all meat with a red chile-type sauce.

nRJYtVu6M9LfdXgWlPOvTw.text: Everyone else pretty much summed it up for me: Fiesta Burrito IS def good-------especially for the price.
